title: HyperLabs Arduino Workshop

Overview
The goal of this workshop/repo is to provide:

Hands-on example code to demonstrate how to use Arduino hardware & sensors

A clean starting point for students/new users to learn how to install, configure, and upload sketches

Organized code and resources so learning is straightforward

title: HyperLabs Arduino Workshop
text:
Examples
The Examples/ folder contains Arduino sketches demonstrating various components:



Sensor
What it is / What it does
Possible Projects
Code




LED
Light-emitting diode; turns on/off to emit light.
- Blink LED- Blink with potentiometer- LED patterns
Open Blink.ino


Potentiometer
Variable resistor; outputs analog voltage depending on knob position.
- Read analog value- Control LED brightness- Control servo angle
Open Potentiometer.ino


Piezo Buzzer
Produces sound when voltage is applied; can play tones or melodies.
- Play a tone- Simple melody- Alarm signal
Open Buzzer.ino


DC Motor
Converts electrical energy to rotational motion; speed/direction controlled via PWM and driver.
- Motor forward/back- PWM speed control- Simple robot drive
Open Motor.ino


Servo Motor
Motor that moves to a specific angle; controlled by PWM signal.
- Sweep servo- Control via potentiometer- Interactive project
Open Servo.ino


Ultrasonic Sensor
Measures distance by sending sound pulses and measuring echo time.
- Measure distance- Obstacle detection- Parking aid
Open Ultrasonic.ino


OLED Display
Small screen that shows text/graphics via I2C or SPI.
- Show text- Display sensor readings- Simple game or graphics
Open OLED.ino


Keypad
Matrix of buttons arranged in rows and columns, read by scanning pins.
- Enter numbers- Create passcode system- Control menus or options
Open Keypad.ino



Oled Commands üîπ Display Control
display.begin(vccstate, i2caddr) ‚Äì initialize display.
display.display() ‚Äì refresh the screen with whatever is in the buffer.
display.clearDisplay() ‚Äì clear the display buffer.
display.dim(true/false) ‚Äì dim or undim the display.
display.invertDisplay(true/false) ‚Äì invert pixels (white ‚ÜîÔ∏é black).
üîπ Text Functions
display.setCursor(x, y) ‚Äì set text position.
display.setTextColor(color) ‚Äì set text color (usually WHITE, sometimes BLACK for inverse).
display.setTextColor(color, background) ‚Äì set text color and background.
display.setTextSize(n) ‚Äì set text size multiplier.
display.cp437(true/false) ‚Äì use full 256-char font instead of ASCII.
display.write(char) ‚Äì write a single character.
display.print(‚Äútext‚Äù) / display.println(‚Äútext‚Äù) ‚Äì print text like Serial.
üîπ Drawing Shapes
(from Adafruit GFX, inherited by SSD1306)
display.drawPixel(x, y, color) ‚Äì draw a single pixel.
display.drawLine(x0, y0, x1, y1, color) ‚Äì draw a line.
display.drawRect(x, y, w, h, color) ‚Äì draw rectangle outline.
display.fillRect(x, y, w, h, color) ‚Äì filled rectangle.
display.drawCircle(x, y, r, color) ‚Äì circle outline.
display.fillCircle(x, y, r, color) ‚Äì filled circle.
display.drawRoundRect(x, y, w, h, r, color) ‚Äì rounded rectangle outline.
display.fillRoundRect(x, y, w, h, r, color) ‚Äì filled rounded rectangle.
display.drawTriangle(x0, y0, x1, y1, x2, y2, color) ‚Äì triangle outline.
display.fillTriangle(x0, y0, x1, y1, x2, y2, color) ‚Äì filled triangle.
üîπ Bitmaps & Images
display.drawBitmap(x, y, bitmap, w, h, color) ‚Äì draw a monochrome bitmap from an array.
display.drawXBitmap(x, y, bitmap, w, h, color) ‚Äì draw XBM image format.
üîπ Screen Size Info
display.width() ‚Äì returns display width.
display.height() ‚Äì returns display height.
Each folder contains a .ino sketch file that can be opened directly in the Arduino IDE.

title: HyperLabs Arduino Workshop
text:
Getting Started
To use this repo:

Install Arduino IDE
If you haven‚Äôt already: download and install the Arduino IDE for your operating system.
Set up your Arduino board

Connect your board (e.g., Arduino Uno) to your computer via USB.

Open Arduino IDE ‚Üí go to Tools ‚Üí Board ‚Üí select your board model.

Go to Tools ‚Üí Port ‚Üí select the correct serial/USB port.
